snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Wednesday’s selections include a look at the evolution of Google Documents, and a way to see how much information can be gleaned from looking...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Wednesday’s selections include a look at the evolution of Google Documents, and a way to see how much information can be gleaned from looking at a Gmail account but not inside the messages.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: The Origin of Google Docs, and Spying on Your Own E-Mail
